Author: Bessel van der Kolk
Description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

Author: Trevor Noah
Description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”

Author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
Description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

Author: Anthony Bourdain
Description: A memoir-exposé of the restaurant world. Originally published in 2000.

Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.

Author: Malcolm Gladwell
Description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice.

Author: Bryan Stevenson
Description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.

Author: Michele Harper
Description: A female African American emergency room physician finds success in a predominantly white male field and examines ways to heal mind, body and spirit.

Author: David Grann
Description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.

Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

Author: Kristin Kobes Du Mez
Description: How rugged masculinity and Christian nationalism play a part in today’s white evangelicalism.

Author: Angela Duckworth
Description: The MacArthur Fellow argues that passion and perseverance are more important than innate talent in creating success.

Author: Daniel Kahneman
Description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.

Author: Michelle Obama
Description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.

Author: Chris Wallace with Mitch Weiss
Description: The Fox News Sunday anchor gives an account of the key people involved in and events leading up to America’s attack on Hiroshima in 1945.
